column1: Kapshagay (Kazakh: Qapshaǵaı; Russian: Капшага́й) is a city in Almaty Region of Kazakhstan. It is located on the Ili River
column2: and has been built along with the construction of Kapshagay Dam on that river in the 1960s. The dam has formed Kapchagay Reservoir (a.k.a. Lake Kapshagai)
column3: a popular weekend destination for beach-goers from Almaty. Population: 39
